title: What is the prize money for the 2025 United Cup?
description: The 2025 United Cup will offer a minimum of US$11.17 million in total prize money and participation fees, with a minimum of US$5.585 million each for ATP and WTA players, respectively. The total prize money is split into three components: participation fee, per team wins and prize money (defined below). Participation Fee No. 1 Player  Singles Ranking $/Player 1-10  $230,000  11-20  $115,000  21-30  $69,000  31-50  $46,000 51-100  $34,500  101-250  $28,750  251+  $23,000  No. 2 Player  Singles Ranking Fee 1-10  $210,000  11-20  $105,000  21-30  $52,500  31-50  $31,500 51-100  $21,000  101-250  $15,750  251+  $10,500  No. 3 Player  Singles or Doubles Ranking Fee 1-30 $33,000  31-100 $16,500  101-250 $8,250  251+ $6,600 Prize Money Match Wins No. 1  Mixed Doubles  Final $280,250  $52,800  SF  $147,500  $27,650 QF $77,600  $14,550 Group  $42,800 $8,000 Team Wins   Final  $25,850  SF $15,250  QF $8,950  Group  $5,600  PIF ATP Rankings Points / WTA Rankings Points Opponent's Ranking  1-10  11-20 21-30 Final Win  180  140  120  SF Win  130  105  90  QF Win  80  65 55 Group Win  55  45 40  Max Points 500  400  345  Opponent's Ranking  31-50  51-100 101-250 251+ Final Win  90  60  40  35  SF Win  60  40  35  25  QF Win  40  35  25  20  Group Win  35  25  20  15  Max Points  260  185  140  110  Participation Fee:   Determined pro-rata based on playing two group stage matches, and the player’s initial team position and ranking at the time of the deadline in which they are accepted.
excerpt: The 2025 United Cup will offer a minimum of US$11.17 million in total prize money and participation fees, with a minimum of US$5.585 million each for ATP and WTA players, respectively. The total prize money is split into three components: participation fee, per team wins and prize money.
text: United Cup Learn the PIF ATP Rankings points breakdown December 26, 2024 Matt King/Getty Images for Tennis Australia The 2025 United Cup will be held from 27 December through 5 January. By ATP Staff The 2025 United Cup will offer a minimum of US$11.17 million in total prize money and participation fees, with a minimum of US$5.585 million each for ATP and WTA players, respectively. The total prize money is split into three components: participation fee, per team wins and prize money (defined below). html:
United Cup

Learn the PIF ATP Rankings points breakdown

December 26, 2024

Matt King/Getty Images for Tennis Australia

The 2025 United Cup will be held from 27 December through 5 January. By ATP Staff

The 2025 United Cup will offer a minimum of US$11.17 million in total prize money and participation fees, with a minimum of US$5.585 million each for ATP and WTA players, respectively. The total prize money is split into three components: participation fee, per team wins and prize money (defined below).

Participation Fee

No. 1 Player 
Singles Ranking $/Player
1-10  $230,000 
11-20  $115,000 
21-30  $69,000 
31-50  $46,000
51-100  $34,500 
101-250  $28,750 
251+  $23,000 
No. 2 Player 
Singles Ranking Fee
1-10  $210,000 
11-20  $105,000 
21-30  $52,500 
31-50  $31,500
51-100  $21,000 
101-250  $15,750 
251+  $10,500 
No. 3 Player 
Singles or Doubles Ranking Fee
1-30 $33,000 
31-100 $16,500 
101-250 $8,250 
251+ $6,600

Prize Money

Match Wins No. 1  Mixed Doubles 
Final $280,250  $52,800 
SF  $147,500  $27,650
QF $77,600  $14,550
Group  $42,800 $8,000
Team Wins
 
Final  $25,850 
SF $15,250 
QF $8,950 
Group  $5,600 

PIF ATP Rankings Points / WTA Rankings Points

Opponent's Ranking  1-10  11-20 21-30
Final Win  180  140  120 
SF Win  130  105  90 
QF Win  80  65 55
Group Win  55  45 40 

Max Points

 500  400  345 
Opponent's Ranking  31-50  51-100 101-250 251+
Final Win  90  60  40  35 
SF Win  60  40  35  25 
QF Win  40  35  25  20 
Group Win  35  25  20  15 
Max Points  260  185  140  110 

Participation Fee:  
Determined pro-rata based on playing two group stage matches, and the player’s initial team position and ranking at the time of the deadline in which they are accepted.
